newsitem.title: BELGIUM: BBL SHARES UNDERVALUED - BELGIAN BROKER.
newsitem.headline: BBL SHARES UNDERVALUED - BELGIAN BROKER.

text.p: Shares in Belgium's Banque Bruxelles Lambert (BBL), which last week posted a 18 percent rise in first half 1996 group net profit to 5.1 billion Belgian francs, were undervalued, Belgian broker Bank Degroof said.

"At the present price level, the shares continue to look slightly undervalued," said Degroof analyst Bernard Hanssens in a research note. The stock, which stood 10 francs up at 5,970 at midsession on the Brussels bourse, remained a "hold".
Hanssens maintained his forecast for full-year earnings per share growth of 11 percent to 525 francs.
